file_content.text: I can't be seen with you anymore.
--off the holo with a very angry Imperial diplomat.
Apparently, some Republic troopers broke into the Imperial detention center!
Hey, I just went to Hari's for a drink. They've got a new waitress there, real looker.
Don't get cute with me, Balkar. You know something.
That breach was a Havoc Squad op. Balkar had nothing to do with it.
That was our fault.
Nice of you to save me the trouble of hunting you down.
Is this a bad time?
Am I interrupting?
On the contrary. Now I know exactly where to stick my foot.
If you're looking for the mastermind behind the raid, he's right here.
Blame Jorgan.
Ah, yes, Sergeant Jorgan, the original "Deadeye" himself. Outstanding work on Ord Mantell.
Ah, yes, Lieutenant Jorgan, the original "Deadeye" himself. Outstanding work on Ord Mantell.
Ah, yes, Captain Jorgan, the original "Deadeye" himself. Outstanding work on Ord Mantell.
Ah, yes, Aric Jorgan, the original "Deadeye" himself. Outstanding work on Ord Mantell.
How did you--?
Senior Agent Zane, SIS. That little stunt you pulled ruined any chance we had of negotiating the Deadeyes' safe return.
Check your facts, Zane. The Imperials already shipped them offworld.
It's Senior Agent Zane, thank you. And storming an Imperial facility, guns blazing? It makes things worse. Your involvement ends now. Clear?
Our involvement ends when the Deadeyes are free.
Our comrades come first.
Then you can tell your CO to expect a little love note from me.
Got it.
So you can follow orders.
As clear as a Hutta swamp on a foggy night.
Not really.
Don't test me.
Now, if you'll excuse me, I've got an Imperial ambassador to mollify. I trust you'll see yourselves off my planet.
What were you thinking, coming back here? I told you I couldn't be connected to any of this.
We found some encrypted coordinates in the prison's central computer. We think they'll tell us where the Deadeyes are.
We were going to see if you could help us, but after that outburst....
We shouldn't involve Balkar.
Yeah, I'd rather keep my job, thanks.
Any chance you can decrypt those coordinates for us?
Can you help us?
Not with Zane watching me.
Maybe we should stop before we get in even more trouble.
This is getting risky.
This is my old squad we're going after--I'll gladly take any heat that comes our way.
Look, a friend in Signal Intelligence owes me a favor. I'll put you in contact with him.
He may be able to make something of those coordinates. It's the best I can do.
Thanks for your help on this one.
It'll do.
Sure thing.
We couldn't have done this without Balkar. I think you owe him your thanks.
Thank the nice man, Jorgan.
Fine. Balkar--thanks.
Hey. Anything for you, Jorgan.
Thanks for nothing.
Your best isn't much.
It's my neck on the line here.
I'll connect with Balkar's contact once we get back to the ship. I'll report if I hear anything.
You don't know me.
You're early. Haven't even had time to order us up a round.
So, how's that 4X unit treating you? Racking up plenty of kills, I hope.
Not that I need a drink to enjoy your company.
The Deadeyes, Balkar--what do you know?
He's right. We didn't come for small talk.
Let's hear it, Jonas.
Fair enough.
You'll have to excuse Jorgan. He's a little on edge right now.
Somebody's impatient.
The man's anxious to get down to business.
Just because Jonas knows how to talk to a woman, it's no reason to get upset.
[Flirt] Jealous, are we?
Sorry, sir. Just hoping to find the Deadeyes before the Imperials execute them.
Fine, fine.
That's enough, soldier.
Don't be rude.
Yes, sir.
I dug up what info I could, but frankly, there isn't much to report.
Far as I can tell, the Deadeyes tried to off some Imperial bigshot. Things went south and they got themselves captured.
We both know the SIS has more intel than that.
Tell me everything.
There's more at stake here than you know.
What's the Republic doing to get the Deadeyes back?
Is a rescue in the works?
Unfortunately, nothing.
The Deadeyes were trained professionals. No way they would have been taken so easily.
That makes no sense.
Even the best make mistakes.
We're on the verge of an incident. The Imperials are out for blood, so the Republic is distancing itself from the operation.
I shouldn't even be talking to you about all this. Those boys are on their own.
These are Republic soldiers, sir--good men, all of them.
We'll find them, Jorgan.
You heard Balkar. The Deadeyes are off-limits.
We can't do anything.
Right, I forgot--regulations outweigh our comrades' lives.
That's unacceptable. The Deadeyes are one of the Republic's top outfits.
If the Republic won't do anything, then Havoc Squad will.
We'll rescue them ourselves.
The Deadeyes knew what they were getting themselves into, Jorgan.
They knew the risks.
Doesn't mean we shouldn't do everything we can to bring them home.
Speak out of turn again and you'll be scrubbing the ship's hull for a month.
Pipe down, Jorgan.
Sir.
Look, I know this stinks, but my hands are tied on this one.
I've got major players breathing down my neck. Otherwise I'd tell you to investigate that prison the Imperials set up in Shadow Town.
Now we're getting somewhere.
Finally, some real news.
You didn't hear this from me.
The Imperials have a facility besides the normal Shadow Town areas?
You mean a traditional prison?
Keep it down. This isn't your usual cantina gossip.
We don't have time for your games, Balkar.
Just tell us what you know.
I'm just trying to cover my butt.
Now, rumor has it--and I'm just talking here--that the Imperials built themselves a makeshift prison not too far from here.
That's where they dump any local riffraff that get out of line. Could be they took the Deadeyes there.
It's a start. We'll look into it.
The Imperial prison. Got it.
The less I know, the better.
Thanks for the tip, Balkar.
I appreciate the info.
I'm just making conversation.
Now, if you'll excuse me, I've got an alibi to work on. Remember--this meeting never happened.
I hope you're not wasting our time.
You better be right.
When have I ever wasted anyone's time?
The lead sounds solid. Least we can do is scope it out.
Me, I've got an alibi to establish. Remember--this meeting never happened.
